title: Freezing
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | It freezes victims, dealing an additional one-quarter of any damage that pierces defenders' armour. It may also slow down cold-blooded creatures. |

The **freezing** [brand](/Brand "Brand") does the following:

- Adds an average of roughly +25% [cold](/Cold "Cold") damage (0% - 50%) to attacks, applied after [AC](/AC "AC") and all damage factors (including [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying")).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- [Slows](/Slow "Slow") down [cold-blooded](/Cold-blooded "Cold-blooded") monsters that are not resistant to cold.

## Contents

- [1 Sources](#Sources)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

### Sources

Along with finding freezing weapons as random loot, or using a [scroll of brand weapon](/Scroll_of_brand_weapon "Scroll of brand weapon"), freezing can be found on a few monsters:

- [Wights](/Wight "Wight") frequently carry weapons of freezing.
- [Frost giants](/Frost_giant "Frost giant") usually generate with freezing [battleaxes](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe").
- [Fannar](/Fannar "Fannar") always comes with a [staff of cold](/Staff_of_cold "Staff of cold") or a [quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff") of freezing

## Strategy

Freezing is one of a couple percentage-based brands that's good enough to beat a 3-rune game. It's especially good against cold-blooded creatures, including the reptiles in [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair") and draconians in [Zot](/Zot "Zot"). Unlike [flaming](/Flaming "Flaming"), freezing works against [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire"), so its somewhat better for Zot:5.

As freezing applies its percentage boost after AC reduction, it is no better or worse when considering strength, weapon type, slaying, or AC. An [executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") of freezing receives the same +25% boost to final damage as a [quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade") of freezing. It's just that a quick blade's base damage is weak, so a brand like [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") or [pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)") will be stronger for it.

## History

- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), unbranded weapons could be temporarily given this brand with the level 2 spell [Freezing Aura](/Freezing_Aura "Freezing Aura"). This temporary brand could be made permanent by reading a [scroll of vorpalise weapon](/Scroll_of_vorpalise_weapon "Scroll of vorpalise weapon").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [attack.cc:1585](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/attack.cc#L1585) (0.30.1)  
   Specifically, if you dealt damage, freezing adds `(1d<damage_dealt>/2) + 0.5` cold damage, rounded down. Therefore, freezing's boost is slightly bigger than 25%. This is more noticeable on weak attacks, e.g. if you dealt 1 damage, you'd always get +1 freezing damage (for an average of +100%).

html:
Freezing

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
It freezes victims, dealing an additional one-quarter of any damage that pierces defenders' armour. It may also slow down cold-blooded creatures.

The freezing brand does the following:

  • Adds an average of roughly +25% cold damage (0% - 50%) to attacks, applied after AC and all damage factors (including slaying).[1]
  • Slows down cold-blooded monsters that are not resistant to cold.

Contents

  • 1 Sources
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Sources

Along with finding freezing weapons as random loot, or using a scroll of brand weapon, freezing can be found on a few monsters:

  • Wights frequently carry weapons of freezing.
  • Frost giants usually generate with freezing battleaxes.
  • Fannar always comes with a staff of cold or a quarterstaff of freezing

Strategy

Freezing is one of a couple percentage-based brands that's good enough to beat a 3-rune game. It's especially good against cold-blooded creatures, including the reptiles in the Lair and draconians in Zot. Unlike flaming, freezing works against orbs of fire, so its somewhat better for Zot:5.

As freezing applies its percentage boost after AC reduction, it is no better or worse when considering strength, weapon type, slaying, or AC. An executioner's axe of freezing receives the same +25% boost to final damage as a quick blade of freezing. It's just that a quick blade's base damage is weak, so a brand like electrocution or pain will be stronger for it.

History

  • Prior to 0.15, unbranded weapons could be temporarily given this brand with the level 2 spell Freezing Aura. This temporary brand could be made permanent by reading a scroll of vorpalise weapon.

References

  1. ↑ attack.cc:1585 (0.30.1)
    Specifically, if you dealt damage, freezing adds (1d<damage_dealt>/2) + 0.5 cold damage, rounded down. Therefore, freezing's boost is slightly bigger than 25%. This is more noticeable on weak attacks, e.g. if you dealt 1 damage, you'd always get +1 freezing damage (for an average of +100%).

It may also slow down cold-blooded creatures.}} The '''freezing''' [[brand]] does the following: *Adds an average of roughly +25% [[cold]] damage (0% - 50%) to attacks, applied after [[AC]] and all damage factors (including [[slaying]]).{{source ref|0.30.1|attack.cc|1585}}
Specifically, if you dealt damage, freezing adds (1d/2) + 0.5 cold damage, rounded down. Therefore, freezing's boost is slightly bigger than 25%. This is more noticeable on weak attacks, e.g. if you dealt 1 damage, you'd always get +1 freezing damage (for an average of +100%). *[[Slow]]s down [[cold-blooded]] monsters that are not resistant to cold. ===Sources=== Along with finding freezing weapons as random loot, or using a [[scroll of brand weapon]], freezing can be found on a few monsters: *[[Wight]]s frequently carry weapons of freezing. *[[Frost giant]]s usually generate with freezing [[battleaxe]]s. *[[Fannar]] always comes with a [[staff of cold]] or a [[quarterstaff]] of freezing ==Strategy== Freezing is one of a couple percentage-based brands that's good enough to beat a 3-rune game. It's especially good against cold-blooded creatures, including the reptiles in [[the Lair]] and draconians in [[Zot]]. Unlike [[flaming]], freezing works against [[orbs of fire]], so its somewhat better for Zot:5. As freezing applies its percentage boost after AC reduction, it is no better or worse when considering strength, weapon type, slaying, or AC. An [[executioner's axe]] of freezing receives the same +25% boost to final damage as a [[quick blade]] of freezing. It's just that a quick blade's base damage is weak, so a brand like [[electrocution]] or [[pain (brand)|pain]] will be stronger for it. ==History== *Prior to [[0.15]], unbranded weapons could be temporarily given this brand with the level 2 spell [[Freezing Aura]]. This temporary brand could be made permanent by reading a [[scroll of vorpalise weapon]]. ==References== {{brands}} [[Category:Brands]]
